  • Method Details

    • createChallenge

      @PostMapping(path="/challenges") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.pvt.project71.domain.dto.ChallengeDto> createChallenge(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid com.pvt.project71.domain.dto.ChallengeDto challengeDto, @AuthenticationPrincipal org.springframework.security.oauth2.jwt.Jwt userToken)
      Create a Challenge.

      POST/challenges

      Parameters:
      challengeDto - Json Body. Expected fields:
      • name (String, Required)
      • description (String, Optional)
      • event (an event json, Optional). The event Json only needs the events id field and nothing else. If and event is not provided it will fallback to the global event
      • points (Integer, Required), must be larger than 0
      • dates(List of dates, required) in format "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm"
        • startsAt(date, optional), if left null it will start at creation, or when the event starts if it haven't yet. The challenge is not allowed to start before the event
        • endsAt(date, required), the challenge is not allowed to end after the event
      • maxCompletions (Integer, Optional), the amount of users that can complete a challenge, if left null there is no limit
      • proofType(ProofType, Required), ProofType is an enum that describes how challenge is deemed completed. For example: REQUEST requires the creator or an admin (if it is a challenge in an event) to approve it.
      userToken - Token to verify and link to a user.
      Returns:
      A responseEntity with status 201 and the created challenge, with its autogenerated id.

      Possible Errors:

      • 400 Bad Request - Missing required field or wrongly parsed Json.
      • 401 Unauthorized - If token is invalid or cant be linked to a user.
      • 403 Forbidden - If trying a User tries adding a Challenge to an event they aren't an admin in.

    • getChallenge

      @GetMapping(path="/challenges/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.pvt.project71.domain.dto.ChallengeDto> getChallenge(@PathVariable("id") Integer id)
      Get a specific Challenge.

      GET/challenges/{id}

      Parameters:
      id - Id of the Challenge to be retrieved
      Returns:
      The challenge with status 200

      Possible Errors:

      • 404 Not Found - If the Challenge doesn't exist.

    • deleteChallenge

      @DeleteMapping(path="/challenges/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity deleteChallenge(@PathVariable("id") Integer id, @AuthenticationPrincipal org.springframework.security.oauth2.jwt.Jwt userToken)
      Deletes a Challenge.

      DELETE/challenges/{id}

      Parameters:
      id - Id of the Challenge to be deleted.
      userToken - Token to verify and link to a user.
      Returns:
      Status 204

      Possible Errors:

      • 401 Unauthorized - If the token is invalid or cant be linked to a user.
      • 403 Forbidden - If the Token isn't linked to the creator, or an admin if the challenge belongs to an event
      • 404 Not Found - If the Challenge trying to be deleted doesn't exist.

    • partialUpdate

      @PatchMapping(path="/challenges/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.pvt.project71.domain.dto.ChallengeDto> partialUpdate(@PathVariable("id") Integer id, @RequestBody com.pvt.project71.domain.dto.ChallengeDto challengeDto, @AuthenticationPrincipal org.springframework.security.oauth2.jwt.Jwt userToken)
      Partially update a Challenge. A partial update only updates fields that aren't empty.

      PATCHchallenges/{id}

      Parameters:
      id - The id of the Challenge to be updated
      challengeDto - Json Body. Expected fields:
      • name (String, Optional)
      • description (String, Optional)
      • maxCompletions (Integer, Optional), the amount of users that can complete a challenge, if left null there is no limit
      • proofType(ProofType, Optional), ProofType is an enum that describes how challenge is deemed completed. For example: REQUEST requires the creator or an admin (if it is a challenge in an event) to approve it.
      Dates, event and points are not allowed to be changed
      userToken - Token to verify and link to a user.
      Returns:
      A responseEntity with the updated challenge and status 200

      Possible Errors:

      • 401 Unauthorized - If the token is invalid or cant be linked to a user.
      • 403 Forbidden - If the Token isn't linked to the creator, or an admin if the challenge belongs to an event
      • 404 Not Found0 - If the Challenge doesn't exist.

    • fullUpdate

      @PutMapping(path="/challenges/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.pvt.project71.domain.dto.ChallengeDto> fullUpdate(@PathVariable("id") Integer id, @Valid @RequestBody @Valid com.pvt.project71.domain.dto.ChallengeDto challengeDto, @AuthenticationPrincipal org.springframework.security.oauth2.jwt.Jwt userToken)
      Fully Update a Challenge. Anything left blank will be updated to blank.

      PUT/challenges/{id}

      Parameters:
      id - Id of Challenge to update.
      challengeDto - Json Body. Expected Fields:
      • name (String, Required)
      • description (String, Optional)
      • maxCompletions (Integer, Optional), the amount of users that can complete a challenge, if left null there is no limit
      • proofType(ProofType, Required), ProofType is an enum that describes how challenge is deemed completed. For example: REQUEST requires the creator or an admin (if it is a challenge in an event) to approve it.
      Dates, event and points are not allowed to be changed
      userToken - Token to verify and link to a user.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with status 200 and the updated challenge

      Possible Errors:

      • 400 Bad Request - Missing required fields or wrongly parsed Json.
      • 401 Unauthorized - If the token is invalid or cant be linked to a user.
      • 403 Forbidden - If the Token isn't linked to the creator, or an admin if the challenge belongs to an event
      • 404 Not Found0 - If the Challenge doesn't exist.

    • getChallenges

      @GetMapping("/challenges") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<com.pvt.project71.domain.dto.ChallengeDto>> getChallenges(@RequestParam(value="user",required=false) String email, @RequestParam(value="eventId",required=false) Integer eventId)
      Get all Challenges with an optional query's.

      GET/challenges?event=id can also just be /challenges

      Parameters:
      email - Optional query parameter to find challenges created by a user.
      eventId - Optional query parameter to find challenges that belongs to an event.
      Returns:
      A list of challenges based on the query with status 200.
